=TUTORIAL=

*<font color= "BLUE">1. How to Access a Note from main GUI:</font>*

Step 1: Press on “+” button to make a new note.

<img src ="http://i27.tinypic.com/51btw3.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 1a.Main Window_

Step 2: Press on the name of the note to access it.

<img src="http://i32.tinypic.com/9zye6o.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 1b.Note View_

Step 3: Press on Edit Title to edit the name of the note’s Title.

			        OR

        Press on Edit Note to edit the content of the note.

        This results in the keyboard to pop-up.

<img src="http://i26.tinypic.com/hsuhs5.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 1c.Keyboard View_


*<font color= "BLUE">2. How to access each letter on the Keyboard: </font>*

Each <font color="CYAN">CHARACTER (blue)</font> button represents three characters. The three additional <font color="RED">SELECTION (red)</font> buttons (Left/Delete, Center/Space, Right/Enter) are used to select a character within the key to be used.

a._To access a letter_, first the user has to press a key that contains the desired character. The <font color="CYAN">CHARACTER</font> button will give access for the user to choose between the three characters it represents. Then, the user has to press the <font color="RED">SELECTION</font> button to select the desired character.

b._To access <font color="RED">“Delete”,”Space”,”Enter”</font>_, the user must press the <font color="RED">SELECTION</font> button without pressing a character key beforehand.

c._To access a <font color="ORANGE">special character</font>_, the <font color="ORANGE">SYMBOL</font> button, the user will have to use the same procedure one has to use for the <font color="CYAN">CHARACTER</font> button.

d._To navigate in the written text_, the <font color="PINK">“left”, ”right”, “top” and “down”  NAVIGATE</font> buttons will have to be pressed by the user. 

e._To access a number_, press the number button, and then press on <font color="RED">Select Center.</font>
* NOTE:* for 0 and 1: press the <font color="CYAN">01 button</font>, then press on <font color="RED">Select Left</font> for 0 and <font color="RED">Select Center</font> for 1.

*<font color= "BLUE">EXAMPLE</font>*

If the user wants to type <font color="CYAN">“W”</font>, the user will have to press the <font color="CYAN">“VWX”</font> button then <font color="RED">“Select Center/Space”</font> button. 

If the user presses the <font color="RED">Select Center</font> button without pressing a <font color="CYAN">CHARACTER</font> button beforehand, then it will put a space. 

<img src="http://i26.tinypic.com/hsuhs5.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 2.Keyboard_

*<font color= "BLUE">3. How to switch keyboards: </font>*

There are three sets of keyboard provided in this application. To switch between keyboards, the user will press the <font color="GREEN">“abc/ABC/123”</font> button.

<img src="http://i26.tinypic.com/hsuhs5.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 3a.Keyboard 1_

<img src="http://i29.tinypic.com/dpd25g.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 3b.Keyboard 2_

<img src="http://i29.tinypic.com/293vhcl.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 3c.Keyboard 3_

*NOTE:* When accessing numbers, click on the number button and then <font color="RED">“Center/Space”</font> button. 

*<font color= "BLUE">4. How to save or delete a note: </font>*

<font color="BLUE">SAVING:</font> 

After the user has finished writing the note, press on the save button - This takes the user back to the Note View.

<img src="http://i26.tinypic.com/hsuhs5.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 4a Save View_

<font color="BLUE">DELETING:</font>

Step 1: Go to the Main Window. Press on Edit.( -This takes you to the Delete Window)

Step 2: Press on the Red button near the note(-Delete Icon Appears)

Step 3: Press on Delete to delete note. 

Step 4: Press on Done to go back to Main Window.

<img src="http://i30.tinypic.com/2v1kcau.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 4b Delete View_


*<font color= "BLUE">5. How to export note to Email/SMS:</font>*

In note view, press on Mail or SMS button to copy the content of the note to the email or text message's body.


<img src="http://i32.tinypic.com/9zye6o.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 5a Note View_

<font color="BLUE">Mail:</font>

Step 1: Select the email address of the recipient from the address book. 

<img src="http://i31.tinypic.com/5qj50.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 5b Email Window_ 

<font color="BLUE">SMS:</font>

Step 1: Select from address book or type in the recipient's phone number.

Step 2: When using the SMS function you have to press and hold within the body of the text message until the paste icon shows.

Step 3: Then press the paste icon to transfer the body of the note. 

<img src="http://i30.tinypic.com/1o0y7o.png" width='350' height='200'>_Fig 5c SMS Window_
